title: Rotational inertia - 3 axes for spheres on rods

content.question: Three spheres, with masses indicated in the figure, are connected by rods of negligible mass. The spheres-rods system makes a rigid body. Axes <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> are also indicated in the figure. The rotational inertia of the spheres-rod system about Axis <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, Axis <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and Axis <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> is <math alttext="l sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="l sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="l sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="l sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="l sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="l sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="l sub 1 equals l sub 2, which equals l sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, l sub 1 equals l sub 3, close parenthesis, is greater than l sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="l sub 2 is greater than, open parenthesis, l sub 1 equals l sub 3, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="l sub 1 is greater than l sub 2, which is greater than l sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, l sub 1 equals l sub 3, close parenthesis, is greater than l sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>I</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
